parts: of the Danites who could keep battle formation, twenty-eight thousand six hundred;

verses.text: of Asher, those who could go out to war, able to keep battle formation, forty thousand;
parts: of Asher, those who could go out to war, able to keep battle formation, forty thousand;

verses.text: of the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the other side of the Jordan, one hundred twenty thousand armed for battle with every kind of weapon of war.
parts: of the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the other side of the Jordan, one hundred twenty thousand armed for battle with every kind of weapon of war.

verses.text: All these men of war who could keep ranks came to Hebron with a loyal heart, to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest of Israel were of one mind to make David king. All these men of war who could keep ranks in a peaceful spirit came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.
parts: All these men of war who could keep ranks came to Hebron with a loyal heart, to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest of Israel were of one mind to make David king.

All these men of war who could keep ranks in a peaceful spirit came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.

verses.text: All these men of war who could keep ranks in a peaceful spirit came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.
parts: All these men of war who could keep ranks in a peaceful spirit came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.

verses.text: Moreover those who were near to them, from as far away as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, were bringing food on donkeys and camels, on mules and oxen; provisions of flour, cakes of figs, cakes of raisins, wine, oil, and oxen and sheep abundantly, for there was joy in Israel.
parts: Moreover those who were near to them, from as far away as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, were bringing food on donkeys and camels, on mules and oxen; provisions of flour, cakes of figs, cakes of raisins, wine, oil, and oxen and sheep abundantly, for there was joy in Israel.

verses.text: Then David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, with every leader. And David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it is of the Lord our God and it seems good to you, let us send to our brethren remaining in all of Israel, and to the priests, the Levites who are with them in the cities of their possession, so they may gather together with us.
parts: Then David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, with every leader.

And David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it is of the Lord our God and it seems good to you, let us send to our brethren remaining in all of Israel, and to the priests, the Levites who are with them in the cities of their possession, so they may gather together with us.

verses.text: And let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we have not sought it since the days of Saul.”
parts: And let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we have not sought it since the days of Saul.”

verses.text: Then all the assembly said they would do so, for this thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
parts: Then all the assembly said they would do so, for this thing was right in the eyes of all the people.

verses.text: So David summoned an assembly of all Israel, from the boundaries of Egypt to as far as the entrance of Hamath, to carry in the ark of God from the city of Kirjath-Jearim.
parts: So David summoned an assembly of all Israel, from the boundaries of Egypt to as far as the entrance of Hamath, to carry in the ark of God from the city of Kirjath-Jearim.

verses.text: David brought it up, and all Israel went up to the city of David, which belonged to Judah, to bring up the ark of God the Lord, who rests between the cherubim, whose name is proclaimed by it.
parts: David brought it up, and all Israel went up to the city of David, which belonged to Judah, to bring up the ark of God the Lord, who rests between the cherubim, whose name is proclaimed by it.

verses.text: So they carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Aminadab; Uzza and his brothers drove the cart.
parts: So they carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Aminadab; Uzza and his brothers drove the cart.

verses.text: Then David and all Israel played music before God with all their strength, with singing, on harps, on stringed instruments, on tambourines, on cymbals, and with trumpets.
parts: Then David and all Israel played music before God with all their strength, with singing, on harps, on stringed instruments, on tambourines, on cymbals, and with trumpets.

verses.text: And when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, because the oxen stumbled.
parts: And when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, because the oxen stumbled.

verses.text: Then the anger of the Lord was aroused against Uzza, and He struck him because he put his hand upon the ark.
parts: Then the anger of the Lord was aroused against Uzza, and He struck him because he put his hand upon the ark.

verses.text: And David became disheartened regarding the Lord's action against Uzza, and called that place Perez-Uzza until this day.
parts: And David became disheartened regarding the Lord's action against Uzza, and called that place Perez-Uzza until this day.

verses.text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How shall I bring the ark of God home by myself?” So David would not move the ark by himself into the City of David, but had it taken aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
parts: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How shall I bring the ark of God home by myself?” So David would not move the ark by himself into the City of David, but had it taken aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.

verses.text: So David would not move the ark by himself into the City of David, but had it taken aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
parts: So David would not move the ark by himself into the City of David, but had it taken aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.

verses.text: The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom, in his house, three months.
parts: The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom, in his house, three months.

verses.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent to David messengers, cedar trees, masons, and carpenters to build him a house. † So David knew the Lord had established him as king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.
parts: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent to David messengers, cedar trees, masons, and carpenters to build him a house.
So David knew the Lord had established him as king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.

verses.text: Then David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.
parts: Then David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.

verses.text: And these are the names of his children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
parts: And these are the names of his children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
parts: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
parts: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

verses.text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
parts: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

verses.text: Now when the Philistines heard David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David.
parts: Now when the Philistines heard David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David.

verses.text: But the Philistines came and raided the Valley of the Giants.
parts: But the Philistines came and raided the Valley of the Giants.

verses.text: And David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines?
parts: And David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines?

verses.text: So he went up to Baal-Perazim, where David defeated them.
parts: So he went up to Baal-Perazim, where David defeated them.

verses.text: And there the Philistines left behind their idols, and David commanded them to burn them up by fire.
parts: And there the Philistines left behind their idols, and David commanded them to burn them up by fire.

verses.text: And again the Philistines made a raid on the Valley of the Giants. And again David inquired of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them.
parts: And again the Philistines made a raid on the Valley of the Giants.
And again David inquired of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them.

verses.text: And again David inquired of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them.
parts: And again David inquired of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them.

verses.text: And it shall be, when you hear the tops of the pear trees rustling in the wind, then you shall enter into battle, for God has gone out before you to defeat the army of the Philistines.”
parts: And it shall be, when you hear the tops of the pear trees rustling in the wind, then you shall enter into battle, for God has gone out before you to defeat the army of the Philistines.”

verses.text: So David did as God commanded him, and they drove back the army of the Philistines from Gibeon as far as Gezer.
parts: So David did as God commanded him, and they drove back the army of the Philistines from Gibeon as far as Gezer.

verses.text: Then the fame of David went out into all lands, and the Lord brought the terror of him upon all nations.
parts: Then the fame of David went out into all lands, and the Lord brought the terror of him upon all nations.

verses.text: David built houses for himself in the City of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.
parts: David built houses for himself in the City of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.

verses.text: Then David said, “No one may carry the ark of God but the Levites, for the Lord has chosen them to carry the ark of God and to minister before Him forever.” And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he prepared for it.
parts: Then David said, “No one may carry the ark of God but the Levites, for the Lord has chosen them to carry the ark of God and to minister before Him forever.” And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he prepared for it.

verses.text: And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he prepared for it.
parts: And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he prepared for it.

verses.text: Then David assembled the children of Aaron and the Levites:
parts: Then David assembled the children of Aaron and the Levites:

verses.text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and one hundred twenty of his brethren;
parts: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and one hundred twenty of his brethren;

verses.text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and two hundred fifty of his brethren;
parts: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and two hundred fifty of his brethren;

verses.text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and one hundred thirty of his brethren;
parts: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and one hundred thirty of his brethren;

verses.text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and two hundred of his brethren;
parts: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and two hundred of his brethren;

verses.text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and eighty of his brethren;
parts: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and eighty of his brethren;

verses.text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and one hundred twelve of his brethren.
parts: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and one hundred twelve of his brethren.

verses.text: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
parts: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

verses.text: He said to them, “You, the heads of the families of the Levites, sanctify yourselves, you and your brethren, so you may bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place I prepared for it.
parts: He said to them, “You, the heads of the families of the Levites, sanctify yourselves, you and your brethren, so you may bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place I prepared for it.

verses.text: Because you were not prepared the first time, because we did not strive for judgment, God divided us within ourselves.”
parts: Because you were not prepared the first time, because we did not strive for judgment, God divided us within ourselves.”

verses.text: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
parts: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.text: As Moses had commanded, in accordance with the written word of the Lord, the sons of the Levites took the ark of God upon their shoulders with bearing-poles.
parts: As Moses had commanded, in accordance with the written word of the Lord, the sons of the Levites took the ark of God upon their shoulders with bearing-poles.

verses.text: Then David said to the chief of the Levites, “Establish your brethren to be the singers with musical instruments—stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals—to sing invitingly in a voice of joyfulness unto His heaven.” So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of their brethren, the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah; and with them their brethren of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers; the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were to sound the cymbals of bronze; Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with strings according to Alamoth; Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, to direct with harps on the Sheminith; Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the music because he was skillful; Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark; Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
parts: Then David said to the chief of the Levites, “Establish your brethren to be the singers with musical instruments—stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals—to sing invitingly in a voice of joyfulness unto His heaven.” So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of their brethren, the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah; and with them their brethren of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers; the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were to sound the cymbals of bronze; Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with strings according to Alamoth; Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, to direct with harps on the Sheminith; Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the music because he was skillful; Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark; Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.

verses.text: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of their brethren, the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
parts: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of their brethren, the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;

verses.text: and with them their brethren of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers;
parts: and with them their brethren of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers;

verses.text: the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were to sound the cymbals of bronze;
parts: the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were to sound the cymbals of bronze;

parts: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the music because he was skillful;

verses.text: Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark;

parts: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.

verses.text: With joy David and the elders of Israel and the captains over thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom. And so it was, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they offered seven bulls and seven rams. David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music master with the singers.
parts: With joy David and the elders of Israel and the captains over thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom.
And so it was, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they offered seven bulls and seven rams.
David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music master with the singers.

verses.text: And so it was, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they offered seven bulls and seven rams.
parts: And so it was, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they offered seven bulls and seven rams.

verses.text: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music master with the singers.
parts: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music master with the singers.

verses.text: Thus all of Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting and the sound of the horn, with trumpets and cymbals, making music with stringed instruments and harps.
parts: Thus all of Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting and the sound of the horn, with trumpets and cymbals, making music with stringed instruments and harps.

verses.text: And it happened, as the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the City of David, that Michal, Saul's daughter, looked out through a window and saw King David dancing and playing music; and she despised him in her heart.
parts: And it happened, as the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the City of David, that Michal, Saul's daughter, looked out through a window and saw King David dancing and playing music; and she despised him in her heart.

verses.text: So they brought in the ark of God and set it in the midst of the tent David had pitched for it.
parts: So they brought in the ark of God and set it in the midst of the tent David had pitched for it.

verses.text: And David finished offering the whole burnt offerings and peace offerings, and blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
parts: And David finished offering the whole burnt offerings and peace offerings, and blessed the people in the name of the Lord.

verses.text: And he divided one loaf of baked bread to every man and woman of Israel.
parts: And he divided one loaf of baked bread to every man and woman of Israel.

verses.text: And he appointed Levites to minister before the presence of the ark of the Lord, to exclaim and give thanks and to praise the Lord God of Israel: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom; Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals; Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, continually before the ark of the covenant of God with trumpets.
parts: And he appointed Levites to minister before the presence of the ark of the Lord, to exclaim and give thanks and to praise the Lord God of Israel: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom; Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals; Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, continually before the ark of the covenant of God with trumpets.

verses.text: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom; Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals;
parts: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom; Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals;

verses.text: Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, continually before the ark of the covenant of God with trumpets.
parts: Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, continually before the ark of the covenant of God with trumpets.

verses.text: Then David by the hand of Asaph and his brethren gave orders to praise the Lord:
parts: Then David by the hand of Asaph and his brethren gave orders to praise the Lord:

verses.text: And they left Asaph and his brothers there, before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to minister continually from day to day according to the service of each day.
parts: And they left Asaph and his brothers there, before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to minister continually from day to day according to the service of each day.

verses.text: And Obed-Edom and his brothers were sixty-eight; Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were gatekeepers;
parts: And Obed-Edom and his brothers were sixty-eight; Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were gatekeepers;

verses.text: Zadok the priest and the brethren of the priests stood before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place in Gibeon,
parts: Zadok the priest and the brethren of the priests stood before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place in Gibeon,

verses.text: to offer whole burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of whole burnt offering every morning and evening; and to do according to all things written in the Law of the Lord that He commanded the sons of Israel by the hand of Moses the servant of God.
parts: to offer whole burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of whole burnt offering every morning and evening; and to do according to all things written in the Law of the Lord that He commanded the sons of Israel by the hand of Moses the servant of God.

verses.text: And with him were Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest chosen out by name to give thanks to the Lord, for His mercy is forever;
parts: And with him were Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest chosen out by name to give thanks to the Lord, for His mercy is forever;

verses.text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals and the musical instruments of God.
parts: and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals and the musical instruments of God.

verses.text: Then all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
parts: Then all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.

verses.text: Now it came to pass when David was dwelling in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under tent curtains.” Then Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.” But it happened that night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying, “Go and tell My servant David, ‘Thus says the Lord, “You shall not build Me a house to dwell in, for I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought up Israel until this day; but I was in a tabernacle, even a tent, in all the places through which I went with all Israel.
parts: Now it came to pass when David was dwelling in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under tent curtains.”

Then Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.” But it happened that night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying, “Go and tell My servant David, ‘Thus says the Lord, “You shall not build Me a house to dwell in, for I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought up Israel until this day; but I was in a tabernacle, even a tent, in all the places through which I went with all Israel.

verses.text: “Now therefore, you shall say this day to My servant David, ‘Thus says the Lord Almighty, “I took you from the sheepfold, from following the flock, to be ruler over My people Israel.
parts: “Now therefore, you shall say this day to My servant David, ‘Thus says the Lord Almighty, “I took you from the sheepfold, from following the flock, to be ruler over My people Israel.

verses.text: And I was with you wherever you have gone, and cut off all your enemies from before you, and made you a name like the name of the great men who are on the earth.
parts: And I was with you wherever you have gone, and cut off all your enemies from before you, and made you a name like the name of the great men who are on the earth.

verses.text: Moreover, I will appoint a place for My people Israel and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no more; nor shall the sons of wickedness oppress them anymore, as previously,
parts: Moreover, I will appoint a place for My people Israel and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no more; nor shall the sons of wickedness oppress them anymore, as previously,

verses.text: and from the days when I appointed judges to be over My people Israel.
parts: and from the days when I appointed judges to be over My people Israel.

verses.text: It shall be when your days are fulfilled, and you shall be laid to rest with your fathers, that I will set up your seed after you, he who will be out of your belly; I will establish his kingdom.
parts: It shall be when your days are fulfilled, and you shall be laid to rest with your fathers, that I will set up your seed after you, he who will be out of your belly; I will establish his kingdom.

verses.text: He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
parts: He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.

verses.text: I will be his Father, and he shall be My son; and I will not take My mercy from him, as I took it from those who were before you.
parts: I will be his Father, and he shall be My son; and I will not take My mercy from him, as I took it from those who were before you.

verses.text: And I will establish him in My house and in My kingdom forever; his throne shall be established forever.” ’ ”
parts: And I will establish him in My house and in My kingdom forever; his throne shall be established forever.” ’ ”

verses.text: So Nathan spoke to David according to all these words and according to all his vision.
parts: So Nathan spoke to David according to all these words and according to all his vision.

verses.text: Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and said, “O Lord God, who am I?
parts: Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and said, “O Lord God, who am I?

verses.text: O God, these things are insignificant in Your presence.
parts: O God, these things are insignificant in Your presence.

verses.text: Yet what will David add that would bring glory to You?
parts: Yet what will David add that would bring glory to You?

verses.text: And according to Your own heart, You have done all this greatness.
parts: And according to Your own heart, You have done all this greatness.

verses.text: O Lord, according to all we have heard with our ears, there is none like You, nor is there any God besides You.
parts: O Lord, according to all we have heard with our ears, there is none like You, nor is there any God besides You.

verses.text: There is not another nation upon the earth such as Your people Israel, whereas God led him in the way, to redeem a people for Himself, to establish for Himself a great and glorious name, to cast out nations from before Your people whom You redeemed out of Egypt.
parts: There is not another nation upon the earth such as Your people Israel, whereas God led him in the way, to redeem a people for Himself, to establish for Himself a great and glorious name, to cast out nations from before Your people whom You redeemed out of Egypt.

verses.text: For You have appointed Your people Israel Your very own people forever; and You, O Lord, became God to them.
parts: For You have appointed Your people Israel Your very own people forever; and You, O Lord, became God to them.

verses.text: “And now, O Lord, the word which You have spoken regarding Your servant and upon his house, let it be guaranteed forever, saying, ‘O Lord, O Lord, the Almighty is the God of Israel.’ And the house of Your servant David has been set aright before You.
parts: “And now, O Lord, the word which You have spoken regarding Your servant and upon his house, let it be guaranteed forever, saying, ‘O Lord, O Lord, the Almighty is the God of Israel.’ And the house of Your servant David has been set aright before You.

verses.text: For You, O my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build him a house.

verses.text: And now, Lord, You are God, and have promised this goodness to Your servant.
parts: And now, Lord, You are God, and have promised this goodness to Your servant.

verses.text: And now You have started to bless the house of Your servant, so it may continue before You forever.
parts: And now You have started to bless the house of Your servant, so it may continue before You forever.

verses.text: After this it came to pass that David attacked the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its towns from the hand of the Philistines. Then he struck Moab, and the children of Moab brought tribute to David.

Then he struck Moab, and the children of Moab brought tribute to David.

verses.text: And David struck Hadadezer, king of Zobah Hamath, as he went to establish his power by the River Euphrates.
parts: And David struck Hadadezer, king of Zobah Hamath, as he went to establish his power by the River Euphrates.

verses.text: David took from them in advance one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers.
parts: David took from them in advance one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers.

verses.text: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer, king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Syrians.
parts: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer, king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Syrians.

verses.text: Then David put a garrison in Damascus of Syria; and the Syrians became David's servants and brought tribute.
parts: Then David put a garrison in Damascus of Syria; and the Syrians became David's servants and brought tribute.

verses.text: And David took the collars of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
parts: And David took the collars of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.

verses.text: Also from those places passed over and from the chosen cities of Hadadezer, David brought a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and the articles of bronze.

verses.text: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah, he sent Hadoram his son, to King David to ask him for peace and to bless him because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him, for Hadadezer was an enemy of Tou, and with him he sent all kinds of articles of silver and gold.

verses.text: These King David also dedicated to the Lord, along with the silver and gold he had brought from all these nations, from Edom, from Moab, from the people of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
parts: These King David also dedicated to the Lord, along with the silver and gold he had brought from all these nations, from Edom, from Moab, from the people of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.

parts: Moreover, Abishai the son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

parts: He also put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David's servants.

verses.text: David reigned over all Israel, and administered judgment and justice to all his people.
parts: David reigned over all Israel, and administered judgment and justice to all his people.

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
parts: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;

parts: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were the priests; Shavsha was the scribe;

parts: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's sons were the king's first successors.

verses.text: It happened after this that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his place. Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father.
parts: It happened after this that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his place.
Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father.

verses.text: And the princes of the people of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David really honors your father because he has sent comforters to you?
parts: And the princes of the people of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David really honors your father because he has sent comforters to you?

verses.text: Therefore, Hanun took David's servants, shaved them, removed the half of their garments as far as their tunic, and sent them away.
parts: Therefore, Hanun took David's servants, shaved them, removed the half of their garments as far as their tunic, and sent them away.

verses.text: Then some reported to David about these men, and he sent someone to meet them, for these men were greatly ashamed.
parts: Then some reported to David about these men, and he sent someone to meet them, for these men were greatly ashamed.

verses.text: When the sons of Ammon saw that the people of David had been shamed, Hanun and the people of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, from Syrian Maacah, and from Zobah.
parts: When the sons of Ammon saw that the people of David had been shamed, Hanun and the people of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, from Syrian Maacah, and from Zobah.

verses.text: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, with the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba.
parts: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, with the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba.

verses.text: Now when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.
parts: Now when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.

verses.text: Then the people of Ammon came out and put themselves in battle array before the gate of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
parts: Then the people of Ammon came out and put themselves in battle array before the gate of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.

verses.text: When Joab saw that the battle line was against him before and behind, he chose some of Israel's best, and put them in battle array against the Syrians.
parts: When Joab saw that the battle line was against him before and behind, he chose some of Israel's best, and put them in battle array against the Syrians.

verses.text: And the rest of the people he put under the command of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in battle array against the people of Ammon.
parts: And the rest of the people he put under the command of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in battle array against the people of Ammon.

verses.text: Then he said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the people of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
parts: Then he said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the people of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.

verses.text: Be of good courage, and let us be strong for our people and for the cities of our God.
parts: Be of good courage, and let us be strong for our people and for the cities of our God.

verses.text: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near for the battle against the Syrians, and they fled before him.
parts: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near for the battle against the Syrians, and they fled before him.

verses.text: When the people of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fleeing, they also fled before Abishai his brother, and entered the city.
parts: When the people of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fleeing, they also fled before Abishai his brother, and entered the city.

verses.text: Now when the Syrians saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and brought the Syrians who were beyond the river, and Shophach the commander of Hadadezer's army went before them.
parts: Now when the Syrians saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and brought the Syrians who were beyond the river, and Shophach the commander of Hadadezer's army went before them.

verses.text: When it was told to David, he gathered all Israel, crossed over the Jordan, and came upon them.

verses.text: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed seven thousand riders of chariots and forty thousand Syrian foot soldiers, and killed Shophach the commander of the army.
parts: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed seven thousand riders of chariots and forty thousand Syrian foot soldiers, and killed Shophach the commander of the army.

verses.text: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they had fallen before Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants.
parts: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they had fallen before Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants.

verses.text: It happened in the spring of the year, at the time kings go out to battle, that Joab led out the armed forces and ravaged the country of the people of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah.
parts: It happened in the spring of the year, at the time kings go out to battle, that Joab led out the armed forces and ravaged the country of the people of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah.

parts: Then David took the crown of Molchol their king from his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it.

verses.text: And he brought out the people who were in it and put them to work with saws, with iron picks, and with axes.
parts: And he brought out the people who were in it and put them to work with saws, with iron picks, and with axes.

parts: Now it happened afterward that war broke out at Gezer with the Philistines, at which time Sibbechai the Hushathite struck Sippai, who was one of the sons of the giant.

parts: Again there was war with the Philistines, and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.

parts: Yet again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, with twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; and he also was born to the giant.

parts: So David said to Joab and to the leaders of the people, “Go, number Israel from Beersheba to Dan, and bring the number of them to me that I may know it.”

verses.text: And Joab said, “May the Lord add to His people a hundredfold as many as they are, and let the eyes of my lord the king see all who are the servants of my lord.
parts: And Joab said, “May the Lord add to His people a hundredfold as many as they are, and let the eyes of my lord the king see all who are the servants of my lord.

verses.text: And this deed appeared wicked before God; therefore He struck Israel.
parts: And this deed appeared wicked before God; therefore He struck Israel.

parts: So David said to God, “I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing; but now, I pray, take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”

parts: “Go and tell David, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord: “I offer you three things; so choose one of them for yourself, that I may do it to you.” ’ ”

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Choose for yourself:
parts: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Choose for yourself:

verses.text: either three years of famine, or that you flee for three months from the face of your enemies and the sword of your enemies utterly destroying you, or that for three days the sword of the Lord and pestilence should be with you in the land, and the angel of the Lord destroying the territory throughout all the inheritance of Israel.’ Now consider what answer I should take back to Him who sent me.”
parts: either three years of famine, or that you flee for three months from the face of your enemies and the sword of your enemies utterly destroying you, or that for three days the sword of the Lord and pestilence should be with you in the land, and the angel of the Lord destroying the territory throughout all the inheritance of Israel.’ Now consider what answer I should take back to Him who sent me.”

parts: And David said to Gad, “Groan for me and for the three exceedingly.

verses.text: So the Lord sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell. And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it.
parts: So the Lord sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it.

verses.text: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it.

parts: Then David lifted his eyes and saw the angel of the Lord standing between earth and heaven, having in his hand a drawn sword stretched out over Jerusalem.

verses.text: And David said to God, “Was it not I who commanded the people to be numbered?

verses.text: So David came to Ornan, and Ornan looked and saw David.
parts: So David came to Ornan, and Ornan looked and saw David.

parts: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the place of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar on it to the Lord.

verses.text: Then King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will surely buy it for the full price, for I will not take what is yours for the Lord, nor offer whole burnt offerings with that which costs me nothing.” So David gave six hundred shekels of gold by weight for his place.
parts: Then King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will surely buy it for the full price, for I will not take what is yours for the Lord, nor offer whole burnt offerings with that which costs me nothing.” So David gave six hundred shekels of gold by weight for his place.

parts: So David gave six hundred shekels of gold by weight for his place.

parts: And there David built an altar to the Lord, and offered whole burnt offerings and peace offerings, and cried out to the Lord; and He answered him by fire from heaven upon the altar of whole burnt offering and consumed the whole burnt offering.

parts: So the Lord commanded the angel, and he returned his sword to its sheath.

parts: At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him, he sacrificed there on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

verses.text: For the tabernacle of the Lord that Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the whole burnt offering, were in the high place at Gibeon at the appointed time.
parts: For the tabernacle of the Lord that Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the whole burnt offering, were in the high place at Gibeon at the appointed time.

verses.text: But David was unable to go before it to seek God, for the sword of the angel of the Lord prevented him.
parts: But David was unable to go before it to seek God, for the sword of the angel of the Lord prevented him.

verses.text: Then David said, “This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar of whole burnt offering for Israel.” So David gave orders to gather all converts to Judaism, those in the land of Israel; and he appointed masons to cut hewn stones to build the house of God.
parts: Then David said, “This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar of whole burnt offering for Israel.”
So David gave orders to gather all converts to Judaism, those in the land of Israel; and he appointed masons to cut hewn stones to build the house of God.

parts: and cedar trees in abundance; for the Sidonians and those from Tyre brought ample cedar wood to David.

verses.text: Now David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, known and glorious throughout all countries.
parts: Now David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, known and glorious throughout all countries.

verses.text: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the Lord God of Israel.
parts: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the Lord God of Israel.

verses.text: And David said to Solomon, “My son, as for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of the Lord my God.
parts: And David said to Solomon, “My son, as for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of the Lord my God.

verses.text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have made great wars.
parts: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have made great wars.

verses.text: Behold, a son shall be born to you who shall be a man of rest, and I will give to him rest from all his enemies that surround him.
parts: Behold, a son shall be born to you who shall be a man of rest, and I will give to him rest from all his enemies that surround him.

verses.text: He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be My son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
parts: He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be My son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’

parts: “Now, my son, the Lord shall be with you and prosper you; you will build a house to the Lord your God, as He spoke concerning you.

parts: Only may the Lord give you wisdom and prudence, and strengthen you concerning Israel, that you may guard and do the law of the Lord your God.

parts: Then you will prosper, if you take care to fulfill the ordinances and judgments that the Lord charged Moses concerning Israel.

verses.text: Indeed I, according to my poverty, have prepared for the house of the Lord one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond measure, for there is so much.
parts: Indeed I, according to my poverty, have prepared for the house of the Lord one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond measure, for there is so much.

parts: Moreover, there are workmen with you in abundance: woodsmen and stonecutters, and all types of skillful men for every kind of work.

verses.text: Of gold and silver and bronze and iron there is no limit.
parts: Of gold and silver and bronze and iron there is no limit.

verses.text: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying, “Is not the Lord your God with you?
parts: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying, “Is not the Lord your God with you?

verses.text: “Is not the Lord your God with you?
parts: “Is not the Lord your God with you?

verses.text: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the Lord your God.
parts: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the Lord your God.

verses.text: And to Paroshom, to Edan, and to Shimei.

parts: The sons of Laadan: the first Jehiel, then Zetham and Joel, three in all.

parts: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran, three in all.

parts: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah.

parts: Jahath was the first, and Zizah the second.

parts: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was set apart that he should sanctify the holy of holies, that he and his sons forever should burn incense before the Lord, to minister and to offer prayers in His name forever.

verses.text: Now the sons of Moses the man of God had been called to the tribe of Levi.
parts: Now the sons of Moses the man of God had been called to the tribe of Levi.

verses.text: The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.
parts: The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.

verses.text: Of the sons of Gershon, Shebuel was the first.
parts: Of the sons of Gershon, Shebuel was the first.

verses.text: Of the descendants of Eliezer, Rehabiah was the first.
parts: Of the descendants of Eliezer, Rehabiah was the first.

verses.text: Of the sons of Izhar, Shelomith was the first.
parts: Of the sons of Izhar, Shelomith was the first.

verses.text: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
parts: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

verses.text: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah was the first and Jesshiah the second.
parts: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah was the first and Jesshiah the second.

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.
parts: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.

verses.text: And Eleazar died and had no sons, only daughters; and their brethren, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.
parts: And Eleazar died and had no sons, only daughters; and their brethren, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.

verses.text: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three in all.
parts: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three in all.

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi according to the houses of their fathers, chiefs of their families according to the number in the household, according to their polls, who from the age of twenty years and older did the work for the service of the house of the Lord.
parts: These were the sons of Levi according to the houses of their fathers, chiefs of their families according to the number in the household, according to their polls, who from the age of twenty years and older did the work for the service of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: For David said, “The Lord God of Israel has given rest to His people, and dwells in Jerusalem forever.”
parts: For David said, “The Lord God of Israel has given rest to His people, and dwells in Jerusalem forever.”

verses.text: And the Levites carried not the tabernacle nor all of its vessels for its ministry.
parts: And the Levites carried not the tabernacle nor all of its vessels for its ministry.

verses.text: For by the last words of David was the numbering of the Levites taken, from twenty years of age and older.
parts: For by the last words of David was the numbering of the Levites taken, from twenty years of age and older.

verses.text: For their duty was to help the sons of Aaron in the service of the house of the Lord, in the courts and in the chambers, in the purification of all holy things and the work of the service of the house of God;
parts: For their duty was to help the sons of Aaron in the service of the house of the Lord, in the courts and in the chambers, in the purification of all holy things and the work of the service of the house of God;

verses.text: for the showbread and fine flour for the meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, the fried cake, and the dough, and for every measure;
parts: for the showbread and fine flour for the meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, the fried cake, and the dough, and for every measure;

verses.text: to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise at evening;
parts: to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise at evening;

verses.text: and regularly before the Lord—at every presentation of a whole burnt offering to the Lord, on the Sabbaths, on the New Moons, and on the set feasts, as by the number according to the ordinance governing them.
parts: and regularly before the Lord—at every presentation of a whole burnt offering to the Lord, on the Sabbaths, on the New Moons, and on the set feasts, as by the number according to the ordinance governing them.

verses.text: They are to keep charge of the tabernacle of witness, of the holy places, and the sons of Aaron their brethren, to minister in the house of the Lord.
parts: They are to keep charge of the tabernacle of witness, of the holy places, and the sons of Aaron their brethren, to minister in the house of the Lord.

verses.text: Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron.
parts: Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron.

verses.text: And Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests.
parts: And Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests.

verses.text: Then David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their census, according to their ministry, according to their fathers’ houses.
parts: Then David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their census, according to their ministry, according to their fathers’ houses.

verses.text: There were more leaders found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar, and thus they were divided.
parts: There were more leaders found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar, and thus they were divided.

verses.text: Thus they were divided by lot, one group as another, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of the house of God, from the sons of Eleazar and from the sons of Ithamar.
parts: Thus they were divided by lot, one group as another, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of the house of God, from the sons of Eleazar and from the sons of Ithamar.

verses.text: And the scribe, Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, one of the Levites, wrote them down before the king, the leaders, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites, one father's house taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.
parts: And the scribe, Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, one of the Levites, wrote them down before the king, the leaders, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites, one father's house taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.

verses.text: Now the first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
parts: Now the first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,

verses.text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
parts: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,

verses.text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
parts: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,

verses.text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
parts: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,

verses.text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
parts: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,

verses.text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
parts: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,

verses.text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
parts: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

verses.text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
parts: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,

verses.text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
parts: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,

verses.text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
parts: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,

verses.text: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
parts: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,

verses.text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
parts: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

verses.text: This was their numbering according to their ministry for coming into the house of the Lord, according to their ordinance by the hand of Aaron their father, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
parts: This was their numbering according to their ministry for coming into the house of the Lord, according to their ordinance by the hand of Aaron their father, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.

verses.text: And the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
parts: And the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.

verses.text: Concerning Rehabiah, of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
parts: Concerning Rehabiah, of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.

verses.text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
parts: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.

verses.text: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
parts: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

verses.text: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah; of the sons of Michah, Shamir.
parts: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah; of the sons of Michah, Shamir.

verses.text: The brother of Michah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
parts: The brother of Michah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, the sons of Beno.
parts: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, the sons of Beno.

verses.text: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah, his sons were Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
parts: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah, his sons were Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

verses.text: Of Mahil: Eleazar and Ithamar; and Eleazar died, and there were no sons by him.
parts: Of Mahil: Eleazar and Ithamar; and Eleazar died, and there were no sons by him.

verses.text: Of Kish: the son of Kish, Jerahmeel.
parts: Of Kish: the son of Kish, Jerahmeel.

verses.text: Also the sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.
parts: Also the sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.

verses.text: These also cast lots just as their brothers the sons of Aaron did, in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites.
parts: These also cast lots just as their brothers the sons of Aaron did, in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites.

verses.text: David the king and the captains of the hosts appointed the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun to their service, for the purpose of playing the lyre and harp, stringed instruments, and cymbals.
parts: David the king and the captains of the hosts appointed the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun to their service, for the purpose of playing the lyre and harp, stringed instruments, and cymbals.

verses.text: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah; the sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph the prophet and were loyal to the king.
parts: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah; the sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph the prophet and were loyal to the king.

verses.text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, after their father Jeduthun on the harp, led the music of thanks and praise to the Lord.
parts: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, after their father Jeduthun on the harp, led the music of thanks and praise to the Lord.

verses.text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
parts: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman the king's chief musician in the words of God, to lift up the horn.
parts: All these were the sons of Heman the king's chief musician in the words of God, to lift up the horn.

verses.text: All these sang hymns with their father in the house of the Lord, with cymbals, and harps, and lyres for the service of the king and Asaph, and Jeduthun, Heman.
parts: All these sang hymns with their father in the house of the Lord, with cymbals, and harps, and lyres for the service of the king and Asaph, and Jeduthun, Heman.

verses.text: And the number of them with their brethren, those being instructed to sing to the Lord, everyone who was skilled in singing, was two hundred and eighty-eight.
parts: And the number of them with their brethren, those being instructed to sing to the Lord, everyone who was skilled in singing, was two hundred and eighty-eight.

verses.text: And they cast lots for their duty, the small as well as the great, those taught and the students.
parts: And they cast lots for their duty, the small as well as the great, those taught and the students.

verses.text: Now the first lot for Asaph of his sons and his brethren came out for Joseph; the second for Gedaliah by Iniah, his brethren and his sons, twelve; the third for Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fourth for Jizri, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fifth for Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the sixth for Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the seventh for Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eighth for Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the ninth for Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the tenth for Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eleventh for Azarel, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twelfth for Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the thirteenth for Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fourteenth for Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fifteenth for Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the sixteenth for Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the seventeenth for Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eighteenth for Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the nineteenth for Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twentieth for Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-first for Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-second for Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-third for Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-fourth for Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.
parts: Now the first lot for Asaph of his sons and his brethren came out for Joseph; the second for Gedaliah by Iniah, his brethren and his sons, twelve; the third for Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fourth for Jizri, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fifth for Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the sixth for Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the seventh for Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eighth for Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the ninth for Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the tenth for Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eleventh for Azarel, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twelfth for Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the thirteenth for Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fourteenth for Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the fifteenth for Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the sixteenth for Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the seventeenth for Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the eighteenth for Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the nineteenth for Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twentieth for Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-first for Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-second for Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-third for Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve; the twenty-fourth for Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.

parts: the third for Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the fourth for Jizri, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the thirteenth for Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the thirteenth for Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the fourteenth for Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the fourteenth for Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the fifteenth for Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the fifteenth for Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the sixteenth for Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the sixteenth for Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the seventeenth for Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the seventeenth for Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the eighteenth for Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve;
parts: the eighteenth for Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the nineteenth for Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the twentieth for Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the twenty-first for Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the twenty-second for Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

parts: the twenty-third for Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve;

verses.text: the twenty-fourth for Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.
parts: the twenty-fourth for Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.

verses.text: Concerning the divisions of the gates: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph. And the sons of Meshelemiah were Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth, Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
parts: Concerning the divisions of the gates: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
And the sons of Meshelemiah were Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth, Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.

verses.text: Moreover the sons of Obed-Edom were Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth, Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.
parts: Moreover the sons of Obed-Edom were Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth, Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.

verses.text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.
parts: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.

verses.text: Also to Shemaiah his son were sons born from the firstborn Roshai in his father's house, because they were men of great ability.
parts: Also to Shemaiah his son were sons born from the firstborn Roshai in his father's house, because they were men of great ability.

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were able men.
parts: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were able men.

verses.text: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons and their brethren, able men with strength for the work: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
parts: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons and their brethren, able men with strength for the work: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.

verses.text: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, eighteen able men.
parts: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, eighteen able men.

verses.text: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons who guarded the first, since he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the first of the second division: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
parts: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons who guarded the first, since he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the first of the second division: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
parts: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.

verses.text: Among these were the divisions of the gatekeepers assigned daily by the leaders of the army, just like their brethren, to serve in the house of the Lord.
parts: Among these were the divisions of the gatekeepers assigned daily by the leaders of the army, just like their brethren, to serve in the house of the Lord.

verses.text: And they cast lots for each gate, the small as well as the great, according to their father's house.
parts: And they cast lots for each gate, the small as well as the great, according to their father's house.

verses.text: The lot of those for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah and Zechariah.
parts: The lot of those for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah and Zechariah.

verses.text: to Obed-Edom the South Gate opposite the storehouse.
parts: to Obed-Edom the South Gate opposite the storehouse.

verses.text: For the second: to Hosah for the West Gate following the Pastophorion Gate of the ascending highway: watchman opposite watchman.
parts: For the second: to Hosah for the West Gate following the Pastophorion Gate of the ascending highway: watchman opposite watchman.

verses.text: On the east were six each day, on the north four each day, on the south four each day, and for the storehouse two by two.
parts: On the east were six each day, on the north four each day, on the south four each day, and for the storehouse two by two.

verses.text: For relief, to the west there were four and on the track there were two relief guards.
parts: For relief, to the west there were four and on the track there were two relief guards.

verses.text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers among the sons of Korah and among the sons of Merari.
parts: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers among the sons of Korah and among the sons of Merari.

verses.text: And their Levite brethren were over the treasuries of the house of the Lord and over the treasuries of the dedicated things.
parts: And their Levite brethren were over the treasuries of the house of the Lord and over the treasuries of the dedicated things.

verses.text: These were the sons of Laadan, the descendants of the Gershonites; to Laadan were the heads of their families; the son of Laadan the Gershonite was Jehieli.
parts: These were the sons of Laadan, the descendants of the Gershonites; to Laadan were the heads of their families; the son of Laadan the Gershonite was Jehieli.

verses.text: The sons of Jetheli, Zetham and Joel, were brothers over the treasuries of the house of the Lord.
parts: The sons of Jetheli, Zetham and Joel, were brothers over the treasuries of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
parts: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:

verses.text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was overseer of the treasuries.
parts: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was overseer of the treasuries.

verses.text: And his brethren by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
parts: And his brethren by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.

verses.text: This Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things which King David and the heads of fathers’ houses, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army had dedicated.
parts: This Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things which King David and the heads of fathers’ houses, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army had dedicated.

verses.text: He also dedicated things taken from battles and from the spoils so that there would not be any lack in the maintenance of the house of the Lord.
parts: He also dedicated things taken from battles and from the spoils so that there would not be any lack in the maintenance of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: And all that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah dedicated—every dedicated thing was under the hand of Shelomith and his brethren.
parts: And all that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah dedicated—every dedicated thing was under the hand of Shelomith and his brethren.

verses.text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons performed outside duties as officials and judges over Israel.
parts: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons performed outside duties as officials and judges over Israel.

verses.text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, one thousand seven hundred able men, had the oversight of Israel on the west side of the Jordan in every service of the Lord and duty for the king.
parts: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, one thousand seven hundred able men, had the oversight of Israel on the west side of the Jordan in every service of the Lord and duty for the king.

verses.text: Among the Hebronites, Jerijah was head of the Hebronites according to their generations, according to their families.
parts: Among the Hebronites, Jerijah was head of the Hebronites according to their generations, according to their families.

verses.text: And his brethren were two thousand seven hundred able men, heads of fathers’ houses, whom King David made officials over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in every edict of the Lord and utterance of the king.
parts: And his brethren were two thousand seven hundred able men, heads of fathers’ houses, whom King David made officials over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in every edict of the Lord and utterance of the king.

verses.text: Now the sons of Israel according to their number—heads of the families, captains of thousands and captains of hundreds and their officers, scribes ministering to the king, and for every affair of the king according to their divisions, for every matter coming in and going out monthly, for all the months of the year, one division of them was twenty-four thousand.
parts: Now the sons of Israel according to their number—heads of the families, captains of thousands and captains of hundreds and their officers, scribes ministering to the king, and for every affair of the king according to their divisions, for every matter coming in and going out monthly, for all the months of the year, one division of them was twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his division were twenty-four thousand; he was of the children of Perez and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
parts: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his division were twenty-four thousand; he was of the children of Perez and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.

parts: he was of the children of Perez and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.

verses.text: Over the division of the second month was Dodai, an Ahohite, and in his division were twenty-four thousand leaders of the army.
parts: Over the division of the second month was Dodai, an Ahohite, and in his division were twenty-four thousand leaders of the army.

verses.text: The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada the priest, who was chief; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
parts: The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada the priest, who was chief; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: This was the Benaiah who was mighty among the thirty, and was over the thirty; in his division was Ammizabad his son.
parts: This was the Benaiah who was mighty among the thirty, and was over the thirty; in his division was Ammizabad his son.

verses.text: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab and Zebadiah his son after him; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
parts: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab and Zebadiah his son after him; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite of the children of Ephraim; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
