verses.text: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbechai the Hushathite of the Zarhites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite of the Benjamites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zarhites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite of the children of Ephraim; in his division were twenty-four thousand.

verses.text: Furthermore, over the tribes of Israel: the officer over the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah; over the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; over the Aaronites, Zadok; over Judah, Elihu, one of David's brothers; over Issachar, Omri the son of Michael; over Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; over Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel; over the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; over the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah; over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; over the sons of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner; over Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham.

verses.text: But David did not take into consideration the number of those twenty years old and younger, because the Lord said He would multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens.
parts: But David did not take into consideration the number of those twenty years old and younger, because the Lord said He would multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens.

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.
parts: Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.

verses.text: And Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king's treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
parts: And Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king's treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.

verses.text: Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.
parts: Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.

verses.text: And Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.
parts: And Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.

verses.text: Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowlands, and Joash was over the store of oil.
parts: Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowlands, and Joash was over the store of oil.

verses.text: And Shitrai the Sharonite was over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that were in the valleys.
parts: And Shitrai the Sharonite was over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that were in the valleys.

verses.text: Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys,
parts: Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys,

verses.text: and Jaziz the Hagrite was over the flocks.
parts: and Jaziz the Hagrite was over the flocks.

verses.text: Also Jehonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a wise man and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons.
parts: Also Jehonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a wise man and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons.

verses.text: Ahithophel was the king's counselor, and Hushai was the king's best friend.
parts: Ahithophel was the king's counselor, and Hushai was the king's best friend.

verses.text: After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then Abiathar.
parts: After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then Abiathar.

verses.text: And David assembled all the chief men of Israel—the chief of the judges, the chief men of those who serve in attendance on the king, the captains of divisions, the treasurers, the lords of his substance and all the king's property, his sons together with the eunuchs, and the mighty men and the warriors of the army.
parts: And David assembled all the chief men of Israel—the chief of the judges, the chief men of those who serve in attendance on the king, the captains of divisions, the treasurers, the lords of his substance and all the king's property, his sons together with the eunuchs, and the mighty men and the warriors of the army.

verses.text: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brethren and my people.
parts: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brethren and my people.

verses.text: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for My name, because you have been a man of war and have shed blood.’
parts: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for My name, because you have been a man of war and have shed blood.’

verses.text: Yet the Lord God of Israel chose me from out of the entire house of my father to be king over Israel unto the age.
parts: Yet the Lord God of Israel chose me from out of the entire house of my father to be king over Israel unto the age.

verses.text: And of all my sons, for the Lord gave me many, He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
parts: And of all my sons, for the Lord gave me many, He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.

verses.text: “And He said to me, ‘It is your son Solomon who shall build My house and My courts, for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father. And if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, I will establish his kingdom forever, as it is this day.’ And now before the whole assembly of the Lord and in the hearing of our God, I charge you to keep and seek all the commandments of the Lord our God, that you may inherit the good land and leave this for your sons to inherit after you forever.
parts: “And He said to me, ‘It is your son Solomon who shall build My house and My courts, for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father.

And if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, I will establish his kingdom forever, as it is this day.’ And now before the whole assembly of the Lord and in the hearing of our God, I charge you to keep and seek all the commandments of the Lord our God, that you may inherit the good land and leave this for your sons to inherit after you forever.

verses.text: And if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, I will establish his kingdom forever, as it is this day.’
parts: And if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, I will establish his kingdom forever, as it is this day.’

verses.text: And now before the whole assembly of the Lord and in the hearing of our God, I charge you to keep and seek all the commandments of the Lord our God, that you may inherit the good land and leave this for your sons to inherit after you forever.
parts: And now before the whole assembly of the Lord and in the hearing of our God, I charge you to keep and seek all the commandments of the Lord our God, that you may inherit the good land and leave this for your sons to inherit after you forever.

verses.text: “And now, my son Solomon, know the God of your fathers, and serve Him with a whole heart and a willing soul; for the Lord searches all hearts and understands every thought.
parts: “And now, my son Solomon, know the God of your fathers, and serve Him with a whole heart and a willing soul; for the Lord searches all hearts and understands every thought.

verses.text: Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary.
parts: Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary.

verses.text: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the temple, its houses, its treasuries, its upper chambers, its inner storehouses, and the house of the mercy seat; and the plans that he had in his mind concerning the courts of the house of the Lord, all the chambers round about the storehouses of the house of the Lord, and the storehouses for the dedicated things; also for the quarters for the daily priests and the Levites for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord; and for the storehouses for the serving articles used to worship in the house of the Lord.
parts: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the temple, its houses, its treasuries, its upper chambers, its inner storehouses, and the house of the mercy seat;

and the plans that he had in his mind concerning the courts of the house of the Lord, all the chambers round about the storehouses of the house of the Lord, and the storehouses for the dedicated things; also for the quarters for the daily priests and the Levites for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord; and for the storehouses for the serving articles used to worship in the house of the Lord.

verses.text: And the measure of their weight both in gold and in silver,
parts: And the measure of their weight both in gold and in silver,

verses.text: he gave to him the weight of the lamps and of the lamp stands.
parts: he gave to him the weight of the lamps and of the lamp stands.

verses.text: He gave to him in like manner the weight for the tables of the showbread, for each table in gold and likewise in silver;
parts: He gave to him in like manner the weight for the tables of the showbread, for each table in gold and likewise in silver;

verses.text: also for the forks, the basins, the pitchers of gold, and the weight of the gold and the silver bowls for each weight;
parts: also for the forks, the basins, the pitchers of gold, and the weight of the gold and the silver bowls for each weight;

verses.text: and the weight of the altar for burning incense made of refined gold he showed to him, and the plans for the chariot of the cherubim that spread out their wings and overshadowed the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
parts: and the weight of the altar for burning incense made of refined gold he showed to him, and the plans for the chariot of the cherubim that spread out their wings and overshadowed the ark of the covenant of the Lord.

verses.text: All these things in writing from the hand of the Lord David gave to Solomon, so that he would succeed in understanding how to follow the plan.
parts: All these things in writing from the hand of the Lord David gave to Solomon, so that he would succeed in understanding how to follow the plan.

verses.text: And David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong and of good courage, and do it.
parts: And David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong and of good courage, and do it.

verses.text: And take notice of the division of the priests and Levites for all the daily service of the house of the Lord.
parts: And take notice of the division of the priests and Levites for all the daily service of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: Furthermore, King David said to the entire assembly, “My one son Solomon, whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced, and the work is a great work, for the temple is not for man, but for the Lord God. According to all means possible I prepared gold, silver, bronze, iron, wood, onyx stones, costly and precious stones of various colors, and much marble for the house of my God.
parts: Furthermore, King David said to the entire assembly, “My one son Solomon, whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced, and the work is a great work, for the temple is not for man, but for the Lord God.
According to all means possible I prepared gold, silver, bronze, iron, wood, onyx stones, costly and precious stones of various colors, and much marble for the house of my God.

verses.text: And because I took pleasure in the house of my God, I gave to the house of my God gold and silver over and above what I procured for myself; more than all I prepared for my house of my God, over and above all I prepared for my consecrated house.
parts: And because I took pleasure in the house of my God, I gave to the house of my God gold and silver over and above what I procured for myself; more than all I prepared for my house of my God, over and above all I prepared for my consecrated house.

verses.text: Three thousand talents of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver to be overlaid in these the walls of the sanctuary
parts: Three thousand talents of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver to be overlaid in these the walls of the sanctuary

verses.text: by the hands of craftsmen.
parts: by the hands of craftsmen.

verses.text: Then the heads of the families, the princes of the sons of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the officers over the king's work, offered willingly. They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
parts: Then the heads of the families, the princes of the sons of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the officers over the king's work, offered willingly.

They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.

verses.text: They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
parts: They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.

verses.text: And whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord, into the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
parts: And whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord, into the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.

verses.text: Then the people rejoiced as a result of their willingness, for they offered willingly to the Lord with their whole heart.
parts: Then the people rejoiced as a result of their willingness, for they offered willingly to the Lord with their whole heart.

verses.text: With this, King David blessed the Lord before all the assembly, saying, “Blessed are You, O Lord God of Israel, our Father, unto the ages of ages. Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the might.
parts: With this, King David blessed the Lord before all the assembly, saying, “Blessed are You, O Lord God of Israel, our Father, unto the ages of ages.
Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the might.

verses.text: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the might.
parts: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the might.

verses.text: From the first, You are the wealth and the glory who reigns over all, as the Lord and dominion of all.
parts: From the first, You are the wealth and the glory who reigns over all, as the Lord and dominion of all.

verses.text: And now, Lord, we give thanks to You, and we praise Your glorious name.
parts: And now, Lord, we give thanks to You, and we praise Your glorious name.

verses.text: “But who am I, and who are my people, that we are able to be zealous in offering to You?
parts: “But who am I, and who are my people, that we are able to be zealous in offering to You?

verses.text: For we are strangers before You and sojourners, as were all our fathers.
parts: For we are strangers before You and sojourners, as were all our fathers.

verses.text: O Lord our God, as for all this abundance which I have prepared that a house should be built to Your holy name, it is of Your hand and all is Yours.
parts: O Lord our God, as for all this abundance which I have prepared that a house should be built to Your holy name, it is of Your hand and all is Yours.

verses.text: I know also, O Lord, that You search the heart and You love righteousness.
parts: I know also, O Lord, that You search the heart and You love righteousness.

verses.text: O Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep under guard these things in the thoughts of the heart of Your people forever, and lead their heart toward You.
parts: O Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep under guard these things in the thoughts of the heart of Your people forever, and lead their heart toward You.

verses.text: And give my son Solomon a fitting heart to keep Your commandments and Your testimonies and Your ordinances and bring to an end the final preparation of Your house.”
parts: And give my son Solomon a fitting heart to keep Your commandments and Your testimonies and Your ordinances and bring to an end the final preparation of Your house.”

verses.text: Then David said to all the congregation, “Now bless the Lord your God.” And everyone in the congregation blessed the Lord God of their fathers, and bowed down before the Lord and the king.
parts: Then David said to all the congregation, “Now bless the Lord your God.” And everyone in the congregation blessed the Lord God of their fathers, and bowed down before the Lord and the king.

verses.text: The next day after the first day, David sacrificed and offered up whole burnt offerings to the Lord—even a thousand calves, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs—along with their drink offerings, and an abundance of sacrifices for all Israel. So they ate and drank before the Lord with great gladness on that day.
parts: The next day after the first day, David sacrificed and offered up whole burnt offerings to the Lord—even a thousand calves, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs—along with their drink offerings, and an abundance of sacrifices for all Israel.
So they ate and drank before the Lord with great gladness on that day.

verses.text: So they ate and drank before the Lord with great gladness on that day.
parts: So they ate and drank before the Lord with great gladness on that day.

verses.text: Then Solomon sat upon the throne of David his father, and was well pleased, and prospered; and all Israel listened to him.
parts: Then Solomon sat upon the throne of David his father, and was well pleased, and prospered; and all Israel listened to him.

verses.text: All the leaders and the mighty men, as well as all the sons of King David his father, were subject to him.
parts: All the leaders and the mighty men, as well as all the sons of King David his father, were subject to him.

verses.text: And the Lord exalted Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel and gave him the glory of a king, which was not given any king of Israel before him.
parts: And the Lord exalted Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel and gave him the glory of a king, which was not given any king of Israel before him.

verses.text: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over Israel forty years, in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.
parts: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over Israel forty years, in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.

verses.text: forty years, in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.
parts: forty years, in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.

verses.text: So he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and glory.
parts: So he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and glory.

verses.text: And the remaining works of King David, the former and the latter, are written in the book of Samuel the seer, in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
parts: And the remaining works of King David, the former and the latter, are written in the book of Samuel the seer, in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,

verses.text: concerning all his reign, his power, and the events that happened to him, to Israel, and to all the kingdoms of the lands.
parts: concerning all his reign, his power, and the events that happened to him, to Israel, and to all the kingdoms of the lands.
